positive.review:
This game... Is... "Beautiful" Although  the graphics are not the greatest, the FRICKING gameplay is BEAUTIFUL compared to fm26 This is a master piece, and should always stay one.

9/10

Note: ignore the graphics since this game is also meant to be playable on mobile but trust me the gameplay is revulotionary
Played it for a little bit but already amazing game like all other soccer manager games 10/10

I have enjoyed the game since picking it up prior to the SM26 update. I am however very disappointed that even though I purchased extra save slots before the update, they were taken away. When the publisher bills the transition as an update rather than a separate game, they should not make you pay for the same benefit again. When I submitted a ticket, I was told that I would need to purchase Ultimate Edition to be able to access my save slots. I was also disappointed with the removal of the Top 50 and the WonderKids rankings during the season. Overall a good game and a lot of fun for a free to play, just wish they had warned players they would lose their SM25 purchases or given the option to stay with SM25.
I recommend this game because if you want a game like Football Manager 26, I would say this is for you. It is also for you if you like football, tactics and managing your favourite club.
it is a good and addictive game, and it is free
it's a decent soccer manager simulator. it is just a reskinned soccer manager 2025

Considering that the game is free, I‚Äôm willing to overlook a lot of things. For example, there are many flaws in the gameplay ‚Äî your player sometimes performs acrobatic moves, and most of the goals end up being headers, which adds an unrealistic element to the game. There are also players who score up to 60 goals per season, which is also a bit unrealistic.

However, the game has its positives too. For instance, the interface is simple (in my opinion, even better than Football Manager 24). Transfers and player scouting are also simplified and enjoyable. I would also like to see the removal of player "boosts," as they make the game less realistic and add a bit of a pay-to-win element.

Overall, as a free football manager game, it‚Äôs not bad ‚Äî I‚Äôd give it a solid 7 out of 10.
On the PC version, there are also no ads, which is great compared to the annoying ads on mobile.

This game‚Äôs clean, man. The new manager traits hit nice, menus are smoother, and matches look way better now. Still a few bugs and paywall vibes, but for a free football sim? It‚Äôs solid.

8/10 ‚Äì one of the best free games.

This game... Is... "Beautiful" Although  the graphics are not the greatest, the FRICKING gameplay is BEAUTIFUL compared to fm26 This is a master piece, and should always stay one.

9/10

Note: ignore the graphics since this game is also meant to be playable on mobile but trust me the gameplay is revulotionary
Played it for a little bit but already amazing game like all other soccer manager games 10/10

Soccer Manager 2026 is basically living the dream of yelling at virtual players without the risk of getting punched. You build your dream team, tweak tactics, buy wonderkids, and watch your carefully crafted strategies implode in glorious 3D. It‚Äôs like being a god of football, but one who occasionally loses to a team made of wet noodles. With over 90 leagues, hundreds of clubs, and more stats than you‚Äôll ever remember, it‚Äôs addictive chaos in a sleek, polished interface. 10/10, I‚Äôve never felt so powerful and so frustrated at the same time.

I have enjoyed the game since picking it up prior to the SM26 update. I am however very disappointed that even though I purchased extra save slots before the update, they were taken away. When the publisher bills the transition as an update rather than a separate game, they should not make you pay for the same benefit again. When I submitted a ticket, I was told that I would need to purchase Ultimate Edition to be able to access my save slots. I was also disappointed with the removal of the Top 50 and the WonderKids rankings during the season. Overall a good game and a lot of fun for a free to play, just wish they had warned players they would lose their SM25 purchases or given the option to stay with SM25.
I recommend this game because if you want a game like Football Manager 26, I would say this is for you. It is also for you if you like football, tactics and managing your favourite club.
it is a good and addictive game, and it is free

The game is pretty good, especially being free. I like how many teams are in the game are the photos of the players. It has many things that you need to do as a manager, so it is realistic. There is a glitch with corners, as sometimes the ball gets stuck in the players hand and when they score it is still in the corner kick takers hand. Aside from the few bugs, it is a very good game with good potential. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a free-to-play soccer/football manager.

The interface is so simple and easy to use. I have been playing SM since 17 and aside from a short period between 19 and 20 have played it consistently since then. Having the new objectives in the game give players something else to play for other than winning the league or european championships.A few bugs, which are usually expected when a new game is launched but Invincibles Studio are great at getting these sorted pretty quickly. Love this game!
amazing game with much personalised feature which i love gotta love the game.
Great game, but there will be some bugs, such as the camera bug, ball bug, and the highlight goal was also buggy. But still has good potential

its great fun realistic,  difficult at times, good graphics, although fans dont clap when a goal is scored , all wearing same colours , not so realistic, but good on field .   I  find sometimes hurts my eyes , to read all figures chemistry etc etc too small , could be larger would be better .
a very good game i recomend getting this if you dont have fc26 because it is free and is the exact same.
the gameplay is great,very realistic fully licensed and very fun
Fun and engaging gameplay, Easy and managable tacticks. really loved this game
Really enjoyed this game, Its not In-Depth as you may want if you come from football manager but decent just to play build a team up.
It's a nice window, but we want an update on the players who left and those who joined, especially Al-Nassr or any team.
Such an improvement from older games and even its a mobile game still can be playable and enjoyable
if u cant afford football manager then this is the next best thing you got, once you get used to the weird playing animation, and the different ui, it actually gets fun
fun to play and create your own team, but ITS SO SCRIPTED you cant keep a clean sheet, the goals you concede are ridiculous

negative.review: Disappointing. I wanted to like it, it feels like it should be good, but ultimately it the way the matches play out don't reflect much of what you do to build your team outside of the matches. Everything is geared towards funneling you into their microtransactions. Don't waste your time unless you really don't mind this.
this game was nice but, the celebration, the cashgrab, the script, needs to be improve

meh
what was a fun strat game for pc got turned into a a Moble cash grab, go back to 2020 model for when this was a good game

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME, THIS GAME IS WORTHLESS...
played this game for 20 seasons and its officially the worst excuse for a manager game ive ever come across. game mechanics are about 20years old and still broken from the original game. manager interaction is pathetic and is always apologist instead of managerial, every player interaction is separate from the game mechanic so a player will get upset and demand transfer listing because of lack of games- what the game fails to account for is that the reason the player wasnt playing was because they took 5 paternity leaves in 1 season and went on international duty BUT GAME FORGETS THIS AND ITS YOUR FAULT lol. no options to discipline or engage players over issues other vthan to take the knee and apologize for something that isnt your fault. after 15seasons the game uses multiple player name replications so you can literally have a team all named the same and still play against poorly generated players. sponsors can suddenly disappear, contracts dont get updated or are incorrect, youth system is a joke as your youth can bankrupt club because you got 20 unknown 17yr olds on 300k a week while main team are on 30-100k. youth also demand 1st team football after a few games instead of being grateful for the opportunity, this whole game is egocentric and unrealistic. game ratio is bias so you need to put in 3x the effort the cpu teams do to get a 3rd of the result- i know this from observing the entire game for 20seasons and paid attention to the shoot/goals etc in every game both my own and cpu vs cpu- its wholly against you and unrealistic- it appears to be stuck in cup tie mode so player will get screwed if the game wants its cup upset yet this can happen to you while in the lower leagues lol. the game doesnt follow official rules, has built in dependencies which are bias against the player, no man marking or zonal marking options lol, game doesnt recognise actual def-mid and att-mid positioning when commentating of games, the assistant is useless and mostly wrong because they cannot read the game correctly when using specific formations and tactics, no info for red cards or injuries, no ability to push back on discussions, manager skill tree is broken and never makes any difference when dealing with contracts, transfers etc, game lacks real management options and should be taken down because it operates on a broken game program with outdated rules and they also deliberately alter the game code so they can get their daily challenges in which goes against free-foam managing, the fact that they charge for content on a broken system is evidence enough that they are ripping everyone off with this sad and ridiculous excuse for a game. lazy updating, lazy programming, lazy functionality, and no effort given to rectify or address the miriad of issues that this game has has for about 20years. 
anyone praising this game are either, idiots who know nothing of football, devs or bots lol.

if you want to win and score lots of goals you have to play very defensive. if you play an attacking formation you will lose games and not score goals. The logic is fantastic and does not make me wanna jump into traffic at all

It's a grind, not fun at all. With 20+ shots and 7-8 shots on goal every match scoring a goal is a serious issue. 2 of the best strikers in the league with 20+ shots every match and i have scored 8 in 9 games. Match engine is on drugs. Was going to buy a pack but thank god i didn't. Even for free i want a damn refund.

Disappointing. I wanted to like it, it feels like it should be good, but ultimately it the way the matches play out don't reflect much of what you do to build your team outside of the matches. Everything is geared towards funneling you into their microtransactions. Don't waste your time unless you really don't mind this.
this game was nice but, the celebration, the cashgrab, the script, needs to be improve

it's not bad. It's... lacking.
I'm a long time player of Champion Manager. Footbal Manager and PC Futbol.
There are some interesting features, such as grounds and stadium development which are a nice touch
The fact that you have to search in the players sheet where they can play since it's not shown easily under their name or the impossibility of changing the position where a player can perform is a bit of a let down.
Also graphics are kinda bad. Not that they're important in this kind of games, but a bit more would be appreciated.
Also you can't see the ratings of the players while the match is going on. If you want to check that, the game goes on pause. Nither can you see your position on the table in real time.
Most of these are not deal breakers on their own, but all of them together make the experience a bit stale.
The game has a lot of potential and, should these issus get adressed, the game itself has a lot of promise.
For free, yeah, i'd give it a try. Wouldn't spend money on it though

It's Just so bad, compared to the last one. colour scheme is horrible, patter of players hitting the ball just awful. I hate the layout of all the menus. I'd rather just play the older one, much more simple, cleaner and easier on the eyes.

Looks promising but really it is just a poorly made mobile game loaded with microtransactions available for pc. I remember enjoying SM16 and 17. Been a life long FM player, 5k hours on 24. SM26 doesn't impress at all.

Absolutely horrific. They've destroyed the match engine completely, nothing works, everything is pre determined. Those pretty manager traits don't work at all. The tactics are nonsense because you literally have to park the bus if you want to score goals. Just save up your money and get FM26

Literally the mobile game just ported onto pc. Only thing better is that there are no ads.
Also the game is partially p2w
